Move config/ json resources back to META-INF/VAADIN/config

This partially reverts earlier changes, moving the config output files `META-INF/VAADIN/webapp/VAADIN/config` back to `META-INF/VAADIN/config`. Motivation:

- Configuration resources are not intended for serving. Having `config/` outside of `webapp/` public resource root fits better in that regard.
- Fixes tests expecting configuration json resources in their original location.

Additionally, this reverts several constants to their original value, including `VAADIN_SERVLET_RESOURCES`, `STATISTICS_JSON_DEFAULT`, and `VAADIN_CONFIGURATION_FILES_PATH` is removed.

A new constant `VAADIN_WEBAPP_RESOURCES` is introduced to refer to the default location of served resources root.

replies.bodyText:
The test already seems to have an exception for publicPath. I think it would be better to keep the code clean and add a similar exception in the test. But also the publicPath is not used anymore (it was previously used in the webpack output options) so that could be replaced with an exception for this rootUrl.
So something like (note that all whitespaces have been removed at this point):
.filter(line -> !line.startsWith("constrootUrl="))
Instead of the current:
.filter(line -> !line.startsWith("publicPath:"))
